elements.title: Pohang Space Walk (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the steps of Pohang Space Walk (pictured) represent an ascent to an unreachable utopia?

elements.title: Justin Yu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Justin Yu, the current Classic Tetris World Champion, is also a cellist in MIT's video game orchestra?

elements.title: tripwire (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a computer system can contain tripwire files that alert administrators upon being accessed by intruders?

elements.title: Bryan Brinyark (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bryan Brinyark finished second in an election to the Alabama House of Representatives just 15 votes behind his opponent, but later won a runoff election?

elements.title: Ad fructus uberes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the papal bull Ad fructus uberes gave friars the right to hear confessions and preach without the authorisation of secular clergy?

elements.title: Dane Hansen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dane Hansen started a road-construction business with about 100 mules that he was unable to sell to the US Army after World War I ended?

elements.title: Hometown Village (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Hometown Village is a community of Sakhalin Koreans who were finally allowed to return to South Korea after the dissolution of the Soviet Union?

elements.title: The Wind's Twelve Quarters (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after Ursula K. Le Guin published her collection The Wind's Twelve Quarters, a reviewer called her the "ideal science fiction writer for readers who ordinarily dislike science fiction"?
